column4: is there a good reason for not using the packages in the repositories?
evolution-exchange is in the repositories, there's no need to compile it
just get evolution-exchange and save the compiling step...
no, you don't need evolution-dev.  All you do is 'sudo apt-get install evolution-exchange' and you are done
no, the evolution-dev will not install evolution-exchange.
is there a good reason for compiling 2.10.3 instead of using the version in the repositories?
when i run apt-get evolution-exchange i get this reply ---> evolution-exchange is already the newest version.
is there a good reason for compiling 2.10.3 instead of using the version 2.10.1 in the repositories?
you need to do 'sudo apt-get install build-essential && sudo apt-get build-dep evolution-exchange' and then do the normal ./configure routine (see ubotu's message)
I just ran the commands to install evolution-exchange; sudo apt-get install build-essential & sudo apt-get build-dep evolution-exchange, ./configure and make and make install.
ok
after install, i open evolution and is still version 2.10.1 and not 2.10.3
were there errors?  You might need to restart or something because I have no idea how evolution-exchange works but it probably stays open in the background
if it worked, i should be able to open evolution, click on ABOUT and have correct version. yes?
evolution-exchange probably runs in the background and the old one is still running
im trying to use a VPN program. I imported a Cisco PFC file, attempt to connect. it fails. I wonder if security on Ubuntu is blocking this VPN connection. Any ideas?
by default, ubuntu ships with no iptables rules so no ports are blocked
I get a connection failed (timeout) error when trying to connect to work using KVpnc. I imported my Cisco PFC file.
I don't know about that
do you know of linux program that allows for MS Office to run on linux? I open Wine and select executable but nothing happens. Im thinking WINE isnt my answer. or is it?
crossover office runs MS office in linux btw
don't know about 2007
